data.text:
Was absolutely shock with this place.

I have been here before normally love the place but this time was not happy I walked out.

Was booked for bottomless brunch for a birthday minimum of ¬£90 spend arrived and was told that I have to order from the outside food area that served hot dogs and burgers and I had to go to the bar and ask for my drinks. I have. Not sure how I was meant to order brunch from a BBQ station I got up and left

data.responseFromOwnerText: Hello Paul, thanks for getting in touch. Unfortunately in this current economic climate, we have had to contend with extra costs ourselves. Lovely place here, friendly staff, clean bathrooms, and as a French person I had my first snails here since I moved to England and it‚Äôs gorgeous, so grateful! (Diff√©rents things on menue, not only snails so don‚Äôt be afraid ü§≠)

But lovely place, beers and food x

data.text:
Lovely decor and very comfortable.
Took my grandchildren for afternoon crepes and ice cream,Ordered a sharing platter which took 25 mins to come then each crepe came out individually at least 10 mins apart and were over cooked. Shame we didn‚Äôt get to eat together.
We have been before and loved it but very very disappointed this time.
data.name: Rhoda Philbin
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your feedback, Rhoda. We only have one crep√© maker so can only do one at a time, but we would like the opportunity to make this right. If you can call us and speak to our management team, or contact us with your phone number, we would like to call and see how we can show you how good we really are, Thanks. The Grove.

data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your 5 üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü rating, Damian. We hope to see you again soon at The Grove, Wilmslow.

data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for your 5 üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü rating, Chris, see you again soon at the The Grove, Wilmslow.

data.name: Stuart Reid
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for our 5 üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü rating, Stuart. See you again soon at The Grove, Wilmslow.

data.text:
What a beautiful venue, quality leather chairs and upholstery, copious amounts of floral decor, friendly staff and delicious food.
We had the spitfire chicken which was amazing and good value, followed by crepes and sticky toffee pudding which was equally as good.
The wine was well chilled on such a hot day and doors and windows were wide open allowing lots of fresh air into the building.
I found the music rather loud for my taste but that's an age thing.
A very pleasant visit thank you.
data.name: Linda Holland
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you so much for giving The Grove, Wilmslow, a üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü, Linda. All of the team are so happy to hear that you loved your experience here. Your drink and food choices sound spot on! We pride ourselves on the quality of our customer service, food, drink and our overall atmosphere and we can‚Äôt wait to see you again soon!

data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for your 5 üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü rating, Tina. See you again soon at The Grove, Wilmslow.

data.text: I was in the grove tonight for the first time and was assisted by a lady named Frankie, what a credit to your team, anything I needed or wanted she was always on hand the girl deserves a big recognition I will be coming back!.

data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the üåüüåüüåüüåü review, Kay. We're glad to hear that you loved our service and atmosphere. We hope to see you again soon inside The Grove, Wilmslow!

data.text: Noisy ,slow service,indifferent food.
data.name: George Bethell
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for your feedback George. Were sorry you didn't enjoy our menu, our food is quite unique but that is something we pride ourselves on. If you would like a quieter experience and more traditional food try our lunch menu complimented by our relaxing jazz music. Our day time lunch experience is very different to the evening entertainment. As for slow service, we will definitely have a chat with the staff regarding this, as regardless of the day/time service is our priority. We hope you try us again.

data.text: Lovely restaurant,  great food, reasonable prices, nice atmosphere,  friendly staff (especially Megan!). Well worth a visit.
data.name: Terry Wayne
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for your 5 üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü's Terry. We appreciate all your feedback, and Megan will be very pleased üòÅ See you again soon at The Grove, Wilmslow.

data.text: Shame the alledged manager of the evening wasn‚Äôt as courteous and professional as the other staff. Rude and unprofessional to say the least!!
data.name: Rosheen Gillies
data.responseFromOwnerText:
We remember this customer visiting the restaurant on St Patrick‚Äôs Day. They drank two bottles of wine and were sitting on a reserved table for a total of 3 hours.
When our staff politely asked them to finish so we could accommodate our next booking they refused and became aggressive and dragged one of our staff‚Äôs arms. 
This behaviour was and always will be unacceptable and we always put the safety of our staff and customers first.

data.text:

Delicious food, great service and lovely decor.
Definitely recommend.

data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your üåüüåüüåüüåü review, David. We're glad that you loved your first visit to The Grove, Wilmslow, and we can't wait to see you again!

data.text:
Visited The Grove at the weekend as an alternative to Konak where we‚Äôd normally go.
Follow on Instagram and always think it looks really inviting.
We were the only people in when we arrived and ordered. Place looks fab inside but wasn‚Äôt impressed with the food.
I ordered sourdough with (specifically asked) well done bacon and poached eggs. Eggs were tiny and stone cold, one piece of small sourdough and barely cooked bacon. My husbands breakfast was nice but my daughters pancakes were forgotten about until we mentioned it again.
Wouldn‚Äôt mind but it was literally only us in there. Our waiter was nice but did seem new and like he‚Äôd been left without knowing what he was doing. Would probably visit again for a drink but would probably give the breakfast a miss
data.name: Heidi Shenton

data.text: Really nice and place for a drink. The atmosphere is good, especially when they have live music on!!

data.responseFromOwnerText: Thanks for the five out of five stars, Amelia. We're glad that you enjoyed your visit to The Grove, Wilmslow, and can't wait to see you here again drinking and listening to more live music on!

data.text: The decor is lovely but are all the flowers and plants worth it when they attract so many little fruit flies? Honestly had about 10 buzzing around my pint and was there 15 mins
data.name: Owen Skinner
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi Owen,

Thank you for your suggestion, we do have partly real plants and partly artificial plants, however, perhaps we should consider just artificial when it‚Äôs fly season.

Kind regards

The¬†Grove¬†Team

data.text:
I'm going to preface this very short review by saying I've been going to the Grove for a few years now, and it's genuinely a nicely decorated place, with lovely staff and nice beers. If you fancy a drink and you're in Wilmslow, you can't go wrong. I'd ordered food there a few times before, and it was really the only criticism I could make about the place - it's all pretty overpriced and just sort of...OK.

I went recently and saw that they'd updated their menu - so I thought I'd give it another go and see if anything had improved. Our very nice waitress informed me that the pie of the day was chicken and leek.

At this point of the thesis, we should take a brief tangent and discuss the meaning of "X of the day" and how it applies to food, because I think there are perhaps numerous schools of thought here. My personal understanding of 'pie of the day' was that it was a pie, made *on the day*, of a specific flavour (with the flavour changing on other days of the week). Now, I was, as you will read, probably very wrong about this assumption. I might even be wrong about the definition of 'of the day'. But if you went to a seafood restaurant and got the 'catch of the day', what does that mean? It's been caught that day, right? Well, based on my understanding of the term, I ordered the pie of the day. What further convinced me was the fact that it was just shy of ¬£15. I mean, ¬£15 must be a good pie, right? Anyway, let's move on.

So, the pie (of the day) arrived, and my heart dropped. I thought I'd be getting a slice of delicious pie, but what I saw on the plate was in all likelihood, an inverted Holland's pie, barely visible above the sea of gravy it was floating in. There was also some mash in there somewhere, which in this analogy, was akin to a murky seabed.

The pie itself was OK. It was a small individual pie, like any you'd find in a shop (for ¬£2.50). The only compliment I could give on the pie was that it wasn't burnt and was successfully defrosted.

The mash was another matter completely. I was actually given the option of chips or mash, and FOOL that I was, I chose mash. The allure of nice fluffy mash with a pie is just too much, but what I received could be mistaken for wallpaper paste. Gluey and bland. I'm 95% sure it wasn't mashed at all, but whipped (over whipping potatoes causes this exact sort of consistency).

The final culprit in the assault on my tastebuds was the gravy. I realise that the reader might think I'm being over dramatic at this point in the dissertation, but I'm not joking, the thing was *swimming* in gravy. I know we're northern up here so gravy runs in our veins, but seriously, the mash had partly disintegrated in the gravy to form some kind of ungodly science experiment on my plate. It wouldn't have even been that bad if the gravy tasted like...y'know, gravy. But no, it tasted like vaguely meat-flavoured salt water.

So, to conclude my OTT internet rant, the pie wasn't very good, but I will attempt to be constructive and offer some points to the Grove, which is doing pretty much everything else right.

1. Don't charge ¬£15 for something if it's going in the microwave or is bought frozen - you're not a fine dining restaurant, I get it, but c'mon guys, ¬£15?! What's the profit margin on those things, 500%?
2. Maybe don't call it pie of the day? I realise this could be me misinterpreting what this actually means to be fair
3. Calm down a tad with the gravy. I love gravy but it's excessive - maybe offer it in a wee boat next to the plate?
4. Whatever you're doing with the mash, just stop doing it. Please. Try something else.

TL;DR pie sucked, beer good. 3 stars.
data.name: ariandude64
data.responseFromOwnerText:
Hi ariandude64, thank you for your feedback. It‚Äôs a shame that your criticism is about the food, however, this also leaves us hopeful as you‚Äôve dined with us in our transition stage with our new menu. Although your standards were not met, we are extremely hopeful here at the Grove that next time you may decide to come for food we can turn you into a Grove food-lover. If you are willing to take this offer up we would like you to come dine complementary, please call us on 01625 625 724 and we can organise this for you. We would like the opportunity to put this right and hopefully win you over with our delicious new menu.

Kind regards,

The¬†Grove¬†Team

data.text:
One of the first things that I was taught at catering college was the 7 P‚Äôs.

Proper preparation prevents piss poor performance.

I don‚Äôt know what the chefs qualifications are at the grove but I don‚Äôt think we learnt to cook in the same place. This performance was piss poor.

Our order wasn‚Äôt complex and it wasn‚Äôt demanding. 2 steak sandwiches a portion of chips and a kids brunch.

I‚Äôve been racking my brains, to try and think about who I have managed within the industry that would potentially hate me so much they would serve me what we received.

The steak in the sandwich was dry, overcooked and rubbery, there was not any sauce or moisture of any kind and the whole dish was unbalanced. At ¬£14 each, you would expected at least edible, hopefully nice, ideally delicious. This didn‚Äôt meet any of those benchmarks.

The chips were ok. Just overcooked. Triple cooked chips have been the rage for a while, but I think these guys have tried to do a Gillette, where they add another razor. Quadruple cooked chips (if that‚Äôs what they are) just taste burnt.

For the kids brunch we ordered sausage beans and scrambled egg. The sausage was decent the beans were good, the scrambled egg was an omelette. Very disappointing. Our two year old human dustbin drew the line at rubbery eggs.

I made the mistake of paying after ordering and before the food arrived. After the food was delivered to the table we did not see another member of staff. Begrudgingly we are the sandwiches. My wife is 7 months pregnant and her blood sugar was all over the place. I was just hungry and wanted to get out of there. I could eat anything if I had to and this was definitely closer to having to than wanting to.

My wife summed it up best as when we were leaving she said ‚Äúwe should have gone to Greggs‚Äù.

I was so angry and disappointed I couldn‚Äôt be bothered to make a scene. We won‚Äôt be returning.
data.name: Nick Louis
data.responseFromOwnerText: We're really sorry for the experience you had when visiting us for a meal with your family, Nick. It's important for us to resolve this issue to make sure that it doesn't happen again, and more importantly, we would like the opportunity to put this right with yourself and your family. If you can contact us and ask to speak with myself (George) or leave your contact details for me to call back I would appreciate a conversation with you.

data.text: The Grove was a great place to stop and eat I spend alot of time in wilmslow and I would highly recommend the Grove ot definitely ticks all the boxes
data.name: Mark Macfarlane

data.text: Great bar, lots of space indoors and outside area front and back. Varied drinks selection...only downside is a bit pricey but overall a good place and atmosphere.
data.name: nigel darbyshire

data.text: Only been once so take this with a pinch of salt but I enjoyed myself! I'm new to the area so it's good getting to know the local drinking holes post lockdown. No craft ales (which is my preferred taste) but they had a decent selection of lagers/pilsners available. The place had a really nice vibe to it and I look forward to going again!
data.name: Dom Wray

data.text:
Great place to visit owner is very friendly and food is excellent. This bar was needed in wilmslow.

Tha owner is Cypriot and brings his amazing dishes to the place from kebabs to home brewed beers.
data.name: mr mouse cheese

data.text: Would have been 5 stars but I spilt my beer on my girlfriend, heads up‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt do that!!!
data.name: Marc Le Maistre

data.text: We had a great evening there until closing time. Your staff up until that point were excellent. Unfortunately when it closing time the bouncer was inconsiderate and aggressive and lacked ANY emotional intelligence to the point where he upset a lot of your clients. He lost his composure when my friend said he was waiting for me as I went to the toilet. He was extremely aggressive and it felt like he was doing it as a power trip rather than doing his job. If it was my business he would not be working there again.
data.name: Lynton Smith

data.text: Giving it a four only because the service is a bit slow. Went out with my partner and every time we needed to order something we had to shout the staff over. The food was absolutely delicious. Definitely recommend the tacos. Lovely atmosphere too.
data.name: Joanna Skonieczna

data.text: Great service and good place to watch the euros and have a beer.
data.name: Wayne Lord

data.text: Lovely atmosphere! The drinks and food were lovely, friendly team and great live musicü§© No doubt I'll be back!
data.name: Saray Ib√°√±ez Soler

data.text: Great atmosphere, beautiful food and lovely staff. Could not recommend anymore !
data.name: Jessica Healy

data.text: Loved it their great pub great people
data.name: Danny Doyle

data.text:
Unfortunately I can't provide an account about my experience regarding the ambience or service one can expect to receive at The Grove, because, unfortunately the "Security Staff", aka, the overzealous fashion police are far too busy casting judgement on (perfectly reasonable) footwear attire and turning away potential custom. The audacity to deny entry to someone for wearing a particular brand, whilst other punters continued to waltz in and out of the premises in flip flops and other egregious forms of fashion baffles me. Such draconian, hypocritical and quite frankly elitist behaviour has sadly left a very sour proverbial taste in my mouth which would very much deter me from returning to the establishment
or recommending it to anyone within my social circle. I'd encourage you to reconsider your current security contract and look for a supplier with the commercial sense to not turn away lucrative business.
data.name: Zest of Europa

data.text: I went there for a day out and come across the grove  the service was excellent and very fast the prices was very reasonable for the size of the steins i had for German beer called paulaner I'll defo be back again soon with friends
data.name: Richard Mayers

data.text: Decent coffee/ tea and scones, but very pricey, eg. ¬£4.50 for a drink of normal 'English Breakfast Tea' is double what I'd expect to pay.
data.name: Brian Bevan

data.text: Cool venue with a great atmosphere. Leah and Sue couldn‚Äôt be more helpful, I will 100% be back
data.name: jonny upton

data.text: Love their outdoor seating and how welcoming and lovely their staff are! Such a fab environment for friends/family/date etc! Defo going to be my weekly go to now :)
data.name: Amy George

data.text: Kind of average. Maybe service is rusty post lockdown. 3 people appeared to be working serving 4 occupied tables and the service was slow and not overly friendly.
data.name: CC Barnes

data.text: Great bar, friendly service, best spot for a beer after work.
data.name: Gerrit Jansen Van Rensburg

data.text: Fantastic place, fantastic service, fantastic people! Beautiful atmosphere and vibes right in the center of wilmslow! Highly recommended!
data.name: Evi Plessa

data.text: Very good service very nice atmosphere, I will definitely go back I suggest you visit it!!!!
data.name: Stefan Chalkiadakis

data.text: I went to the grove for the first time, decor was cute one girl served us who was really friendly and helpful so thank you to her :) However one of the male servers made a mistake whilst serving us and instead of just apologising and explaining he made a mistake, which we would of been understanding towards, lied about the situation which caused a whole confrontation. The manager was unhelpful and again instead of apologising for the situation made our whole table of 4 feel uncomfortable, he was very outspoken that he believed his member of staff over the 4 of us on the table and i felt as though the whole experience was very unprofessional, we came out for a nice drink for the first time after lockdown and i feel as though a clear mistake could have been handled in a much nicer way.
data.name: sophie williams
